feed.title: Category: python | Maciej Kus -- Bay Area JavaScript Developer

entry.title: using-d3-to-visualize-data
entry.content:
I started playing with d3.js, a visualization library. I got some data from the kickfurther website using a little python script I wrote. The script parsed out the relevant data and saved it as a JavaScript object.

From there I used Interactive Data Visualization for the Web as an intro to d3.js and built a fun little bubble graph. I don’t know if a bubble graph is the most informative way to present this data, but it was the coolest looking, and mainly I was attempting to learn d3.js.

Check out my Kickfurther visualization.
